title: Treating titles of specimens in text
content:
Is there a common method of referring to type specimens in copy? In other words, should I italicize all of them, or should I only italicize the books and set the names of shorter booklet/brochure style specimens in quotes?

 [‹ What is this typeface?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907010903/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45077 "Go to previous forum topic") [Frutiger Condensed Italic Font Pack? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907010903/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45165 "Go to next forum topic")
author: James Puckett

comments.content: Wouldn’t you italicize the specimen if you are referring it to as a whole, and put in quotes if you are referring to a section within?
